meanings.definition: To fall forward or to one side.
meanings.sent1: The tower was toppling in the wind.
meanings.sent2: The vase was toppling off the edge of the table.
meanings.sent3: The toppling bookshelf made a loud crash.
meanings.sent4: The toppling dominoes created a chain reaction.
meanings.sent5: The toppling tree branches blocked the path.

meanings.definition: To remove from a position of power or authority.
meanings.sent1: The rebels were toppling the corrupt government.
meanings.sent2: The shareholders were toppling the CEO from his position.
meanings.sent3: The kids were toppling the reigning champion in the game.
meanings.sent4: The scandal was toppling the once-respected politician.
meanings.sent5: The employees were toppling the unfair rules with their protests.

meanings.definition: To cause to fall or tumble over.
meanings.sent1: The strong wind was toppling the fragile statues.
meanings.sent2: The earthquake was toppling buildings in the city.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat was toppling the stack of papers.
meanings.sent4: The giant wave was toppling the small boats in the harbor.
meanings.sent5: The careless mistake was toppling the carefully arranged blocks.
